rename.from: patching a MODULE.bazel fails with permission denied in 8.4.x
rename.to: patching a MODULE.bazel fails with permission denied in 8.4.x with experimental_repository_cache_hardlinks

body:
I've never thought about this before, but doesn't that show that `--experimental_repository_cache_hardlinks` really is an unsafe optimization? A repo rule doesn't know when it is in effect and may subsequently modify "downloaded" files, which can then either poison the cache or fail with this error.

@meteorcloudy @Wyverald Do you see a way to make this safe? We could limit hardlinking to `rctx.download_and_extract`, where it likely provides the biggest benefit and is also safe since the archive file is kept in an internal temp directory. `FileSystemUtils.copyFile` could be improved to use reflinking if available.

issue.title: Make download cache entries read-only

labels.name: team-ExternalDeps
labels.description: External dependency handling, remote repositiories, WORKSPACE file.

repository.name: bazel
repository.description: a fast, scalable, multi-language and extensible build system

issue.body:
Avoids silent corruption when the entry is hardlinked into a repo and modified there.

Related to #27446

body: How is this triggering `ctx.download` to fail exactly? I don't quite understand the differences between `download_and_extract` and `download`

`ctx.download` doesn't fail, but the subsequent patching modifies the hardlinked download cache entry, which may not be writable and could also be modified concurrently. `ctx.download_and_extract` never modifies the intermediate file and hides it from the user.
I see, then `--experimental_repository_cache_hardlinks` is just not safe for `ctx.download`. Or maybe this should be an attribute of the download APIs?

I investigated this more thoroughly and found these separate issues:
1. `http_archive` downloads the MODULE.bazel file after patches are applied. This is correct for remote patches coming from the registry (as those are typically applied to get the checked-in file into the same state as the one in the registry). But it is not correct for local patches, which should be applied on top of the registry module file.
2. Hardlinked download cache entries can no longer be modified after https://github.com/bazelbuild/bazel/pull/27451, which means that `rctx.download` shouldn't use hardlinking. I wouldn't introduce an attribute just yet - that's a lot of extra complexity that will be unnecessary once we use reflinking for copies (@tjgq and I are looking into this).
3. Something else that results in permission denied in this reproducer. Will look into this more.

issue.title: Download registry module file before applying local patches

repository.name: bazel
repository.description: a fast, scalable, multi-language and extensible build system

issue.body:
Download the module file before applying local patches since users should still be able to modify it via a `single_version_override`. Also make sure to delete any existing module file first since the one obtained from the source archive may not be writeable.

Fixes #27446

issue.title: Only use hardlinks in `rctx.download_and_extract`

labels.name: team-ExternalDeps
labels.description: External dependency handling, remote repositiories, WORKSPACE file.

repository.name: bazel
repository.description: a fast, scalable, multi-language and extensible build system

issue.body:
The repo rule may modify the file downloaded via `rctx.download`, so it isn't safe to hardlink it.

In the future, when `FileSystemUtils.copyFile` is backed by Java's `Files.copy`, copying can reflink and thus recover the performance gain without using hardlinks.

Related to #27446

body: 2 is fixed by https://github.com/bazelbuild/bazel/pull/27453, 1 and 3 are fixed by https://github.com/bazelbuild/bazel/pull/27455.
@novas0x2a Thanks for making us aware of three bugs with just one issue :-)
